document.docAuthor: Singh, Navneet, Volynkin, Anton V., Kirti, Jagbir Singh, Datta, Harvinder Singh & Ivanova, Maria S.
document.docTitle: Cyana arama subsp. metis Volynkin & N. Singh 2020, ssp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A review of the genus Cyana Walker, 1854 from India, with descriptions of five new species and three new subspecies (Lepidoptera: Erebidae: Arctiinae: Lithosiini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the genus Cyana Walker, 1854 from India, with descriptions of five new species and three new subspecies (Lepidoptera: Erebidae: Arctiinae: Lithosiini)

heading.emphasis:
Cyana arama metis Volynkin & N. Singh
, ssp. nov.

1500 m
,

, leg. F. Smetaсek”, slide MWM 34425 Volynkin (Coll. MWM / ZSM ).

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. In ancient Greek mythology, Metis is a Titaness belonging to the second generation of Titans, the mother of wisdom and deep thought.

Diagnosis. Forewing length is 19–19.5 mm in males and 20–21.5 mm in females.
Cyana arama metis
differs from the nominate subspecies by its narrower and paler amber yellow forewing transverse lines. The male and female genitalia of two subspecies have no significant differences.
